meanings.definition: Yeed (verb): to throw or toss forcefully
meanings.sent1: He yeed the ball across the field.
meanings.sent2: She yeed the paper into the trash can.
meanings.sent3: The monkey yeed the banana at the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The wind yeed the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent5: The angry player yeed his racket in frustration.

meanings.definition: Yeed (noun): a loud, enthusiastic exclamation or cheer
meanings.sent1: The crowd let out a yeed of joy when the team scored.
meanings.sent2: Her yeed of excitement echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected yeed from the audience surprised the performers.
meanings.sent4: His yeed of victory could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The yeed of support boosted their morale during the competition.
